Key Match Events: Charlie Blackmon hit a two-run home run in the eighth inning
Ezequiel Tovar hit his NL-leading 45th double to tie the game
Ryan McMahon and Michael Toglia hit doubles to give Colorado its first lead of the day
Sam Hilliard and Hunter Goodman struck out swinging to begin the eighth inning with Colorado down 8-5
Jake Cave tripled, Aaron Schunk singled, Blackmon walked, and Tovar hit a double to score five runs with two outs in the eighth
Pre-Game Insights: Only four outs left, but you watch enough games to think anything can happen, and this was an instance today where it did
The shadows were bad in the box, making it tough to see
The team didn’t quit, and they had a lot of late life there
Post-Match Reflections: Aaron Schunk singled, Blackmon walked, and Tovar hit a double to tie the game
Charlie Blackmon got the Rockies back into the game with a two-run homer in the second inning
Charlie Blackmon was in the lineup for the season’s final three games this weekend
The Rockies need to take two of three from the Dodgers this weekend to avoid their second consecutive 100-loss season
Miscellaneous Highlights: Thomas Saggese booted Blackmon’s grounder to start the first inning
Jordan Walker misplayed Toglia’s liner to right field allowing Blackmon to score
Ivan Herrera homered 446 feet to center on a hanging changeup
Pedro Pagés tagged Angel Chivilli for a two-run homer in the eighth inning
Victor Vodnik pitched a scoreless seventh inning
Cal Quantrill will pitch for the Rockies in the upcoming series against the Dodgers
